title: 103_hr796
content: The Act titled "Freedom of Access to Clinic Entrances Act of 1993" ensures freedom of access to reproductive health services. Chapter 13 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include a new section prohibiting activities that block access to reproductive health services through force, threats, intimidation, or physical obstruction. Damaging or destroying property of facilities providing reproductive health services is also prohibited. Penalties and civil remedies are outlined for violators, with exceptions for parents or legal guardians of minors. The new section in Chapter 13 of title 18, United States Code prohibits activities that block access to reproductive health services through force, threats, intimidation, or physical obstruction. Penalties for violations include fines and imprisonment, with increased penalties for subsequent offenses or if bodily injury or death results. Civil actions can also be taken by aggrieved individuals. The new section in Chapter 13 of title 18, United States Code allows for civil actions to obtain relief for violations related to blocking access to reproductive health services. Relief can include injunctive relief and compensatory or punitive damages for aggrieved individuals. The new section in Chapter 13 of title 18, United States Code allows for civil actions to obtain relief for violations related to blocking access to reproductive health services. Relief can include compensatory or punitive damages for aggrieved individuals, with the option to recover statutory damages of $5,000 per violation. The court may also award reasonable fees for attorneys and expert witnesses to the prevailing party. Rules of construction clarify that the section does not prohibit protected expressive conduct or interfere with state authority to regulate reproductive health services. Rules of construction clarify that the section does not prohibit protected expressive conduct or interfere with state authority to regulate reproductive health services. Congress does not intend this section to provide the exclusive remedies with respect to the conduct prohibited by it, nor to preempt the legislation of the States that may provide such remedies. Definitions for terms like 'reproductive health services', 'facility', and 'physical obstruction' are provided. The term 'obstruction' refers to blocking access to reproductive health services, making it difficult to enter or exit a facility. The definition of 'State' includes various regions within the United States. 'Intimidate' means causing someone to fear bodily harm. The Act takes effect upon enactment and applies to conduct occurring after that date. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the United States Code.
